content.question: Which of the following best explains the reason for the establishment of historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs)?

choices.label: African Americans continued to face segregation and discrimination when applying to both public and private white colleges and universities.
The federal government and Jim Crow laws limited access to Black Greek-letter organizations in traditionally white colleges and universities.
African Americans believed advanced education could train them in resistance strategies, such as political activism and trolley boycotts.
The federal government sought to establish a system to promote African American involvement in the activities of the Freedmenâ€™s Bureau.

content.answer: African Americans continued to face segregation and discrimination when applying to both public and private white colleges and universities.
